events.message: Customer reported a car accident occurring on April 30th involving rear-end collision with minimal injuries.
The filed claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial accident report and vehicle damage photographs.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to manage and follow up on the customer's auto accident claim to ensure timely processing.
Acknowledgment of the claim was sent to the customer confirming receipt and informing about the next steps in the claims process.
Request made for additional documents including the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and repair estimates for further assessment.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed repair estimates and the official police report of the accident.
Investigation was initiated by the claims department to verify the circumstances of the collision and liability aspects.
Comprehensive investigation concluded confirming the driver was not at fault and damage estimates were validated by a third-party expert.
Settlement offer was drafted and proposed to the customer covering all approved repair costs and related claims.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer expressing appreciation for the prompt and fair resolution approach.
The claim was formally approved by the claims manager after verifying that all criteria and documentation were satisfactorily met.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued to the customerâ€™s designated account covering all vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following successful payment and receipt of confirmation from the customer.
All claim documents and correspondence related to the auto accident were archived in the system for future reference.
